venue.name: Dyer Street Dock (Gazebo on Dyer Street)

item.description:
This is the Second of the events I will be scheduling to offer the opportunity to assist with staging a Waterfire.

This will be a great opportunity to do something different and have plenty of chance to chat with other newcomers, other Waterfire volunteers and make great contacts within the community.

I will update this with the exact times of the effort, however, here's how it works; I'll be coordinating with the Waterfire volunteer coordinator and let her know how many newcomers will be assisting. She'll schedule us in and we'll show up and work a 5 hours shift, which will start somewhere around 6:30pm and run till the event ends at 11pm. Please do not signup if you cannot commit to the full shift.

Activities to be expected - Wear ALL BLACK - this is a requirement. If we are assigned boat duty, all black, but practical. Shore duty is business casual.
- Ambassador of light
- Starry Starry Night support
- Boat Crew (unlikely)

Before the shift, I'd recommend that we get together for a meal at somewhere close to the event. Perhaps the Red Fez, or McFaddens. I'll schedule that separately.

Free parking for volunteers is available at the Park Rite lot at 198 Dyer Street.
item.how_to_find_us: Volunteer Checkin tables are here, I'll be here and be easily found.
item.name: Evening of Volunteering for Waterfire w/ dinner beforehand
